website_summaries.verdict: Offers a combination of some nice features and a low price, but it also comes with the possibility of some technology issues.
pros: Has Fire TV, so owners can enjoy access to many top streaming apps
Affordably priced, especially considering it's a smart model
cons: Issues with the remote have been reported, and Alexa is confusing to set up

customer_reviews.title: Does not pair with tv
customer_reviews.text: Remote does not pair up with tv and best buy customer service was very unhelpful in resolving the matter.
customer_reviews.author: yampu freeman

customer_reviews.title: No wonder it was discounted
customer_reviews.text: The instructions and the YouTube video says *When lifting or handling, DON'T TOUCH OR PINCH THE SCREEN* but when we pulled it from the box (via the plastic bag handles) there were already big, ugly oily fingerprints along both sides of the screen!!! I set it up and crossed my fingers but yuck!....when I turned it on there was big DARK BLOTCHY GHOSTING along either side of the screen. Whoever packed it had to grab it hard enough to damage it and I'm ticked, but just too fed up with Amazon to argue about it. Good luck with YOUR TV.....I hope whoever packed it wasn't as rough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screen damaged upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I was excited that this tv got to me faster than the expected shipping date. HOWEVER, during set up, I noticed a small white line running down the screen vertically. This is some sort of screen or LED damage. It never went away except when the tv was off. Every screen variation had it, so, I will be returning this item. I wish I could review other aspects of this tv but I was too frustrated to move further along in the set up process. The box was slightly banged up, but on the opposite side that the screen was showing damage. So... not happy with this purchase right now.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: Remote and tv won’t sync. Haven’t been able to get passed the “language” screen. Unable to pair remote with “home screen” have reset remote and nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon V.

customer_reviews.title: Great TV at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We had a small TV in our kitchen for years. And that quit work and we looked for something to replace that we needed something small but still with a good picture. We ordered the Insignia smart TV at a great price point of $99 because it was in sale. We plugged it in and immediately had a great picture and began using the apps that were installed. We easily added more apps. Absolutely a great deal. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B

customer_reviews.title: Good TV for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got a 32" Fire TV Edition, received it 2 days earlier than the expected delivery date. The package box wasn't neat, you can see it from the picture I posted. The TV itself looks OK, I had it set up and connected to wifi, everything worked, hopefully no issue, picture quality is OK for the size is only 32", sound quality is so so only. I rate it 5-star because over all it's not bad, now finger cross hope it will not have any problem.
customer_reviews.author: MasJc

customer_reviews.title: Annoying with all its problems
customer_reviews.text: 3 of these have gone bad in less than a year. The latest one started having problems in less than a week. One minute you are wAtching tv and the next second it goes back to the menu. Eventually it gets to where you can’t watch for more than a minute before it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sending out an SOS
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is very poor. We have Vizio brand we’ve always bought from Costco. This tv absolutely sucks. The picture is grainy then back to clear then grainy. None of my other TVs are like this. We have fire sticks on those. I can’t believe how bad this is. I can’t return it. The damn box went out with trash. I’m so upset and disappointed in this. All to save $30. 😭😭😭 anything omg HBO is a joke on this tv. Like I said the app on the others with the fire stick. No problems. Idk. Just weird. Everything is fuzzy!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee mother of sons

customer_reviews.title: Terrible wifi connectivty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv as a gift for my daughter. It's caused so much frustration from the beginning (bought it a year ago). The wifi connectivity is terrible. She has tried all the fixes multiple times (resets, clearing caches, etc.). Sometimes they work for awhile and then, once again, cannot watch any Netflix, etc. Essentially, the tv is no longer being used at all since it won't work. So disappointing! Don't buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Hegarty

customer_reviews.title: Good to start
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few weeks, then just after the 30 days expired guess what, yep it broke. Best Buy does not want to know or help. I will NEVER buy from Best Buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Varley

customer_reviews.title: Much better picture and sound than TCL
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after two of our TCL tv's died (one with less than 20 hours of viewing and two weeks out of the box and TCL refused to do anything). We were surprised how much better the picture and sound quality were.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utter disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: The Wi-Fi is garbage for smart features on the tv, but connecting my Roku stick to the tv has no issues. The TV has disconnected from my network almost every day, with no visible option to save the password each time I've re-entered it. Considering the smart features were why I spent the extra $40 compared to a same spec tv at Walmart otherwise, you're better off getting a non smart TV and a Roku or Fire Stick that will actually stay connected to the internet. Voice recognition gets a 2 for convenience when it actually works, which is dependent on being connected to the internet. Picture is as expected, sound is strangely low using smart options.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing!! Started out looking for a smart TV, and ran across this one on Best Buy's website. Went there to find they are totally out of TVs. Looked in Amazon, and they had the same TV for much less. So I ordered it. 2 days later, it was at my door. I had done a lot of reading about it already, but when I fired it up, WOW!! This thing is incredible. Picture, sound, features are over the top for what you would expect for a TV this inexpensive. I'm thrilled with it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV, Fire TV remote will not control any equipment
customer_reviews.text: Beware. As a standalone Fire TV, this unit is very nice. But if you have a sound bar or any other equipment that you would want controlled with one Fire TV remote (like the current Fires Stick remotes do under "equipment control") then forget about it. Only pick this TV for the price or just because you simply love it. I have to have one remote to control everything, and being a Fire TV/Recast house and 2nd home, its the Fire TV remote that must do it all. This one however, and **************ALL Fire TV's****************** do not.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: A very good wifi TV with good features.
customer_reviews.text: We like the convenience how easy it is to set up and move around. It very light, works great as a second video device. You will need access to an over the air antenna, to receive local channels. Im looking into a device that connects to my wifi router as i have an outdoor roof mounted antenna. One thing i not found of is the bing internet interface, clunky and limited in my opinion. For the price we're happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: NOT A 32 INCH
customer_reviews.text: The TV is great and all but this is definitely not a 32 in TV. Its more 28. The sell a small size for a big price. That was very disappointing as the moment I saw it I knew it wasn't the size as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: TAKES FOREVER TO DO EVERYTHING!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i liked was that it had the amazon stick features! WHAT I DIDNT LIKE: 1) it takes 3-5 minutes to turn on! 2) if it doesn't turn on with the remote you have to plug it out then plug it back in where it also takes a few minutes to turn on! 3) It has a delay; meaning you press the volume or up/down button and it takes a few minutes before it responds. 4) When u download the apps it keeps undownloading and you have to sign in again. 5) it tells you to check the connection(wifi). You check it its fine, but the tv keep saying to check it.
customer_reviews.author: peaches

customer_reviews.title: USB on 32" will NOT play videos!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv for our family and we watch a lot of videos from an external hard drive whether it be family videos, sermon videos or movies. This tv will NOT play them. When you go to "media files" (what it calls the USB port), it just says that it's empty. NOT HAPPY!! There is NOTHING in the listing that says it only shows JPEG or I would never have bought this tv. Picture quality is good, but that is a big flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SandrasKitchenNook

customer_reviews.title: Great little TV
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a GREAT TV for the $$$!! We got this for our kitchen to watch football or YouTube while cooking, works fantastic! We have an 86" one that obviously cost MUCH more, but I can honestly say that the picture on this little baby is pretty darn good! The voice remote is awesome, And it comes pre Loaded with so many apps!
customer_reviews.author: cat h

customer_reviews.title: Great bedroom size
customer_reviews.text: Insignia is a good TV for the money. My 7 year old was begging for a TV for her new painted room. I had her do some chores and found this for $99 and thought "PERFECT." Was looking for a smart tv this size so she could load up disney, netflix, amazon. Works well, easy attach tv stand, stable, great picture. I can't attest to sound quality, but she doesn't complain and it seems okay to me. I've had Insignia before and that is BestBuy's budget brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: What in the world is going on?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tv on June 17, 2020. At first the tv worked great, however yesterday, Sept. 13, 2020, the remote no longer opened Netflix or the other buttons on the remote control. I am getting a message that says, "Your tv cannot connect to the Amazon Cloud service. Features that require internet connectivity have bee temporarily disabled." What does this mean? Why would I have internet connectivity one day and not the next? Others have had similar problems, but I have gotten no further from the tv itself. Anyone out there have ideas on what to do?
customer_reviews.author: sassycat

customer_reviews.title: Damaged goods!! "Brand new" TV looks more like used and abused!
customer_reviews.text: Not only was the TV a day late, it came DAMAGED!!! I ordered this TV for my 11yr old son, he's had a small TV for some time now so I figured it's time for an upgrade.. Unfortunately his smile turned into a frown when we turned the TV on to set up the accounts and everything and the screen has no picture and the screen appears to be cracked or smashed.. VERY disappointed thank god we didn't throw out his old one just yet.
customer_reviews.author: EmeraldCity

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SECOND SET
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Insignia TV. The picture is superb! I use an HDTV antenna and still pull in up to 47 channels, depending on the atmospheric conditions. I haven't had time to investigate all the whistles and bells in this Fire TV but mostly they don't really interest me because of the content (it's aimed for the most part at a younger generation) and since almost all of the extras require a subscription or a pay-per-view fee that's not in my budget. Like I said ... great picture ... at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Calicokid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have not owned a TV since 2008. When my laptop's monitor just suddenly went white; I panicked. This TV had good reviews, was a nice size and seemed like it would bring life back to my monitorless laptop. It ticked all the boxes. Simply plugging in an HDMI cable and leading it to my laptop. Having no idea what a 'smart tv' is - I played with the various options and now find myself enjoying Netflix and Prime VIdeo with just one press of a button. Beleive all the reviews - this is a fantastic TV.
customer_reviews.author: EyeLoveGlassesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Bedroom TV
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small bedroom SmartTV that was just enough to watch occasionally at bedtime. It had to be a smaller size to scale with our furniture and not kick off so much light at night. I read a lot of the reviews that stated issues with WiFi connectivity so I was cautious and even tried to cancel the order before delivery. Thankfully I didn't. Several months later, the TV has worked out great. There was a lengthy initial software update, so maybe the initial problems have been worked out. I'm a happy customer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jay C.

customer_reviews.title: Worst tv ever
customer_reviews.text: Not smart at all. I have a fire TV add on with the remote. And it works great. My mom needed a new TV so I got her the insignia fire TV, thinking, incorrectly, that it could only be better. Voice activated remote doesn't work. We thought we had WiFi issues even though the tech said the signal was strong enough. So I had him run a wire directly into the tv. STILL ISSUES. Horrible tv. I would never have bought this knowing this...I am disappointed that Amazon would let such a poor product represent their brand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It keep changing the channel.
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 minutes of watching TV, this TV switches back to the homescreen. You can build up a fast reflex that switched you back to the channel you were watching, but by then you have missed something on the show. I guess I will just send it back because it is driving me nuts. The screen looks good. The remote could use some basic features like: Channel up, channel down. COME ON PEOPLE. CHANNEL UP AND CHANNEL DOWN FOR CRYING OUT LOUD. WHY WOULD YOU NOT INCLUDE THOSE?!
customer_reviews.author: A. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, met all my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This tv was one of the few things I’ve bought just for me. I spend more time working in the kitchen than anyone else, and this perfectly-sized tv is exactly what I wanted. The picture is perfect, the unit is super light and compact, and I love having only one remote. It was a breeze to set up, everything meshed with my existing Fire account, so I only had to sign in to my other apps, such as Sling. The tv was a bargain, and I really hope it’s well made and lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra K.

customer_reviews.title: T.V went blank after a month of purchase
customer_reviews.text: I knew when I bought it that it wasn't the best t.v but I didn't expect for it to die on me so soon. I tried everything to get the picture back but no luck. I can't say for sure that it's the brand Insignia tv's because I have one for 7 years and it still works, even though it is not a smart tv. I was watching tv then all of a sudden the picture died, and I couldn't get it back. I'm gonna see if I get a replacement from the retailer (Bestbuy) if not, then 150.00 dollars LOST
customer_reviews.author: Pedrito Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It's only 720P so....
customer_reviews.text: Please sure you know what you're getting, the 32 inch HDTV is only 720P. I don't know anyone who would want a 720P tv in this day and age of affordable 4K sets. Do yourself a favor and make sure you're okay with a lesser resolution. I'd say spend another 50 or 100 to get a 4K Smart TV. I thought this was at least 1080P but anyway. I'll sell this one locally to get a better smart tv. 720P just won't cut it nowadays unless you're playing older gaming systems, dvds, or OTA stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Deiradinn

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi quit after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a great television. I bought it just so I could tuck it into a corner of the dining room and have somewhere I could watch movies and play on the PS4 without having to hog the living room. The wifi chip entirely died just a few weeks after I bought it, irritating but I had a range extender I could move till it was close and just attach it with an ethernet cable. So it's not nearly as cheap as it sounds - I'm just waiting for the Amazon Fire hardware inside to die now. I expect it's just a matter of time.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: Bad investment for streaming
customer_reviews.text: Although there are no issues with my Wi-Fi settings as I have checked them frequently, I have constant issues attempting to watch anything on this TV. Netflix and Hulu never seem to function correctly, and are always crashing. I don't understand why this TV just doesn't function the way it should, because I never had any issues utilizing Roku in the same room. I wish I bought a Roku enabled TV instead.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy - with a surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I bought TWO smart televisions - by accident! (Hit the wrong button or something) We received the two TVs and set one aside to return - already received instructions and a label from Amazon. We set one of the sets up easily These sets have kept us 'sane' during the pandemic. We could only take so much bad news over the 'regular cable channels'. We may end up canceling our cable services - which charge us WAY too much for channels we don't even want or watch (curling, Australian Football, Spanish Language movies, soccer . . . )
customer_reviews.author: John H. Degnan

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi all the time
customer_reviews.text: Decent TV. It's really cheap which is nice. However like most reviews it loses wifi in the middle of your show. Frustrating point is you have to either power down as in unplug or do a device restart and enter all your IP info again. Having some great internet it Saint Petersburg Florida with 300mb down this shouldn't happen. Not much of a tech guy at all but I can see its using channel 36 to connect. The signal shows excellent but no internet available. I would not recommend at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Logan M.

customer_reviews.title: best tv ever
customer_reviews.text: this tv does it all. and has 4 hdmi inputs. that's a lot of peripherals to the same tv. very nice. i'm a streaming media kinda guy and this matches my needs. bring your amazon prime subscription with you. many streaming apps are free with commercials. the apps that require a cable subscription are clearly labeled in the app details page before downloading it. a huge time saver for me. if you're looking for a tv that doubles as another monitor into a pc with a decent video card, this isn't that. i love the tv and would buy another if the need arises. very good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Webb

customer_reviews.title: easy set up,  great picture, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Had it 6 hours so far. Was hard to get srand on, bolts very short, so i taped it on to screw driver to get it in hole, worked great, when partially threaded pulled back screw driver and removed tape. No further problem. Easy to set up. Great picture. Navigating web with remote hard, but can get mouse for it. So far really like it. Great price also. Still really like this, been a week. Did try a mouse to scroll up and down on internet. Didn't work, but keyboard space key worked. I love JGLM TV. Some menus have multiple messages in them. Couldn't scroll down, with remote, it doesn't allow dragging. Great set, great price.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great tv for my daughter! It’s perfect because all the apps are already on the tv. My 6 year old is easily able to navigate the tv. Picture and sound quality great. I have noticed it has lagged but I believe this is normal with smart TVs because it’s running off your home internet. I have also noticed this on my fire stick on a different tv, so I can’t say it’s the television being “slow”. Overall great buy for the price, definitely a bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: LINDSEY

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Won’t connect to my TV provider
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to set-up the television today and spent two hours trying to understand why we could not access any apps by connecting to our cable TV provider. Amazon reps were clueless and after having us restore the tv to factory settings continued place blame with the cable provider - even though we were able to connect two non-Amazon devices to the same cable provider while on the phone with Amazon. Tired of trying so the television is being returned. Total waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even had this for 5 months and it’s already broken. The display is great, but nothing works anymore. I only have Prime, Netflix and Hulu. None of them work. I click on the app, pick a show or movie then it kicks me out and goes back to the home screen or just freezes. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: 1 month later, no Prime Video play back
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for 1 month. Up until a few days ago it worked just fine. 2 days ago it started telling me that my WiFi signal was weak when attempting to watch Prime Video and would not allow the video to play. I would check in the settings under network and it showed me my 5G connection and would show the connection as very good. It would also play Netflix content just fine. I have uploaded a video showing this. My router during the video is in the same room as the T.V.. unfortunately the box for the unit has been thrown out. So I believe a return won't work?
customer_reviews.author: Skairkrow

customer_reviews.title: Need to unplug and plug back in every time you turn it on
customer_reviews.text: This television appears to turn on normally (screen lights up with rectangles for Amazon Prime, etc.), but after you turn it on, it is unresponsive to the remote control until you unplug it, wait a minute, plug it back in, then turn it on again. This TV might be fine for someone who leaves it on all day, but for us it is a real annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Spinner's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Not as convenient as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have about 50 local broadcast channels. Sometimes 3 or 4 of them will be broadcasting the same event; but when one has an intermittent signal another will be strong. Most of these are not described in Amazon's description boxes. If I know the channel number, Alexa can go there; but if I only know a channel number close to the one I want. I really miss the keypad and the channel up and down buttons.
customer_reviews.author: John C. West Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Decent television...if you actually get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two, one for each bedroom in our camper. One works great. The other will not access apps. Called within warranty and was told it was a bad remote. New remote was sent out promptly, but did not solve the problem as the apps still Won’t open. We came to the conclusion that the fire stick feature was not installed on one of the TVs. And now, since it’s out of the 30 day return window, we’re stuck with a tv that doesn’t have the features that were the reason we chose this tv. It’s a decent tv. Just make sure the fire stick was actually installed and do it within the ridiculously short return period.
customer_reviews.author: TeachMomof3

customer_reviews.title: Great price/features
customer_reviews.text: 720p HD with Amazon Firestick. Plenty of HDMI ports for Roku and Apple etc. Lightweight and a crystal clear picture. Love the Firestick feature and to be frank, that it had RGB Video/Audio in so I didn't have to use up my HDMI port for the SATELLITE TV. Remore is smaller and more simple, versus so many that are large with unreadable, unnecessary buttons. Still cant get over the price.
customer_reviews.author: J Ro***

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This product SUCKED!!.. I didn't want to be so irate but this was a wool pull over my eyes. I know that one at times gets what they pay for,but I didn't know I purchased a "recycled" TV... Never again will I buy Insigina products or deal with best buy!
customer_reviews.author: H Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Smart TV under $100
customer_reviews.text: Gets a nice picture and set up was easy. Set up was easy. EXCEPT it arrived without the screws needed to attach the feet. Had to make a quick run to the local hardware store to get some screws that would fit + little duct tape for an added safety measure. Got this smart tv so Disney+ works in the kids bedroom. Xmas shopping is now complete. lol
customer_reviews.author: SusanKnows

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It's everything It's described to be except I can't cast my phone to the T.V. that's minor and not enough of an issue not to recommend. The pitcure is great. Love the fact firestick capabilities are built in. TV allows 3rd party app downloads. Great sound and you don't need a separate remote. Plug in, connect to internet and start watching. Glad I caught while it was on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Luvume

customer_reviews.title: NO sound, bad service, good picture
customer_reviews.text: I would give this TV a zero star if I could. The picture is great but there is no audio. After talking to insignia customer service and waiting on hold for about 6 hours and multiple disconnection and several agents they were able to diagnose that it was "most likely a manufacturer defect". They told me that I needed to contact amazon instead since it was within 15 days. Extremely difficult customer service. Very frustrated that my TV does not even perform the basic function of a television- sound.
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in a prime sale and wow how can you go wrong with such a bargain? The picture is great, you dont really notice it's 720p since the screen is only 32 inches. I love that it's quite zippy, it feels faster than my fire stick gen2 devices i got in regular tv's. I dont use it for cable or any other inputs, usually just Plex. My only wish was that I can reprogram the buttons on the remote that I do not use. I dont have PS Vue or HBO so now i'm stuck with 2 buttons on the remote for that. Rather map 1 to Plex for instance.
customer_reviews.author: Rutger

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe the price!
customer_reviews.text: $109. Do I need to repeat that? At that price it deserves five stars just if it turns on. Then subtract $39.99 for the fire stick that you don't have to buy and you're out $69 for a 24" TV. Plus the picture is great and Alexa even works with an over air antenna. This provides seamless transition from live TV to your apps and Amazon prime. Set up was a breeze and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Happy with everything but two features
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at how good the picture is on this TV. I like the image and sound. I DON'T like the fact that I cannot find anywhere to turn off the mic (it is Alexa enabled and I don't want the mic on, ever). I also do not like the remote. I have small hands but it is too small and too slippery. My husband hates it! Other than those items, we are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works great on WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly satisfied with this purchase. We bought the TV to replace our old tube type TV in our motor home. We could not have been happier with the result. We use Sling TV and it worked flawlessly on the campground's WiFi. We were also connected to their cable TV, but ended up not using it because changing channels on this TV is definitely NOT one of it's strong points unless you are using an app. Changing channels on normal cable TV requires going to a channel guide that has no data about the channel or tv shows on the channel. Still happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: iamoldschool

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I write about TV for a living and have a 65 inch Sony OLED as my main, 42 inch Sony LED for bedroom, and wanted a small TV for my office. This 32 inch is perfect! Incredible quality, works perfectly syncing with Apple TV and Altice One (router in the other room, so I don't need to pay an extra $10pm for an extra connection). Slightly sorry I paid $700 for the LED now, as this would have been great for my bedroom, too! Can't beat it for the price. Great picture and sound. Not one problem with it and I have it on for hours a day - probably more than the other two.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality TV for the price & size
customer_reviews.text: So far I am absolutely loving this TV. I’ve been using my iPad to watch all my favorite shows. So I finally decided to purchase a TV. The price was perfect for the size 32” and for its features. I added the 2 year warranty just in case anything happens to it within that time frame. I think it was an additional $10. Altogether I paid $160. The remote came with batteries so I didn’t have to scrounge around looking for any. Simple setup, minimal assembly required for the feet of the TV. If you’re looking for a great little started TV that won’t break the bank I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic deal. We are running this system without any cable and only using Internet services in our home. I absolutely love this television.
customer_reviews.author: Shelia Merritt

customer_reviews.title: No idea if this is a good TV or not
customer_reviews.text: The inane hassle I am dealing with, trying to access my Amazon account with this TV is killing the fun. No, plug and play it is not for me it seems. It does not recognize the Amazon account. Says invalid account. Has me go through hoops, entering serial number,etc with an Amazon rep....same thing, the TV does not recognize my Amazon login information. I got 3 TVs working fine, 2 from Amazon. My error? Buying a FIRE tv instead of a ROKU tv like I normally do :) I am sure they will resolve it eventually, or refund me, either or, it should not be this convoluted. Roku in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Oddity
customer_reviews.text: I have had this TV a few months and finally had to face facts. I really don't like the format of this TV. The remote is designed so that if you choose to not use voice command you will be limited in controlling your device. It is Amazon driven, period. I don't need to have my TV viewing boxed in by a device desgined to have an INTRUSIVE influence over my viewing selections. I'm only keeping it because I've learned to bypass or ignore the most annoying features. The only plus to this TV is the picture quality. They tried it🤨
customer_reviews.author: EmpressP

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $100
customer_reviews.text: Image is grainy, colors are distorted at best, bad at worst. Whites show up as grays, greens as blue. Does not look good with either the inputs or the fire tv features. The fire tv features themselves run slowly and take longer to load than on the stick. Plastic on the remote is cheap, and buttons and circle are made of the same cheap plastic. You’re better off buying a fire tv and a different brand tv than buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky Vetos

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Really didn't expect much from a small inexpensive 'smart' TV. It was a replacement for a more expensive (same size, smart, etc) TV placed in my basement in front of our treadmill. (who isn't working out at home these days?!?!) Really surprised with ease of set up, quality of the picture, and best of all use of CC (can't hear a thing with the treadmill going, cc is pretty much imperative). VERY happy with it and recommend it highly to anyone with similar requirements.
customer_reviews.author: NOMWA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV!
customer_reviews.text: Right from the box, this tv has exceeded expectations! I bought this for the kitchen. I chose Fire Tv over Roku because of reviews as well as being a Prime subscriber, it made sense to have everything available on the home screen. Also, I can use the firestick I bought for the TV I replaced on another tv. It is plug n play, but you can customize the home screen. The picture quality is amazing, the sound is, and stays crisp, the more I amplify it. The voice command is spot on and fun! Everything about is impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Cherilyn

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only a few months
customer_reviews.text: This Fire TV just stays in a rebooting loop. It never stays on long before rebooting. Can't watch anything. Warranty is too short to return. Update: After having problems with the remote and the TV, I took both to the Geek Squad. They did a factory reset on the TV and so far it is working well. Best Buy (Insignia) does give you a one-year warranty. Hope the reset works.
customer_reviews.author: Cancer Patient

customer_reviews.title: an item that can't be returned
customer_reviews.text: I followed directions and tried to cancel this-couldn't. I was told to tell ups to return it and she put it back on the truck. 3 days later it appeared at my door again. be careful who supplies to amazon. I should have thrown this in trash and not returned it. I lost $160.00. I have been with amazon for 5 years, it's no longer the same place.
customer_reviews.author: richard corbett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tv. Best remote ever
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tv. Wifi connect is simple and fast with a super clean picture. Disregard any 1 star ratings that are weird people complaining about the remote being lost or not working and can only replace via amazon. Guess what people it's an amazon tv. Try using any firestick remote or download a remote and you're good to go. Great tv
customer_reviews.author: The NerpS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: I almost did not buy this TV because of some of the reviews but I am happy I did. I purchased this for a spare room in my house and swapped my 24 inch in my bedroom for this one because the picture is so much better! Its a great additional tv. I attach my laptop to it when I am working on a design project by hdmi cable. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This tv has everything I need but there’s a lot of lag when it comes to navigating the main menu. I turn it on and click the down arrow and it freezes up and finally works and brings me all the way to the bottom of the page. I also had volume issues recently where I had to put my volume up to the max and it was still quiet. The speakers are only on the sides so the sound travels to the sides instead of in front. You can hear the tv better from the hallway than you can my bed. I will continue to use until it really stops working but I wouldn’t recommend or repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: 3 month old TV no loner works.  Never turned on properly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One works like a charm, the other not so much. It has always had an issue with powering on, I seen past this problem to begin with. But all and all. One television works, the other is a piece of junk, and inconvenience, its in worse shape then my old TV, and we have had this TV for 3 month and used it probably 20 times. I would return, but I no longer can return this product. Disappointed to say the least with 1 television.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remote stopped working within two months
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this television, but beware the remote is a piece of junk. It stopped working within two months of use. The buttons get stuck and go haywire. I read other complaints of the same thing. A replacement is $40!
customer_reviews.author: ACB

customer_reviews.title: This TV is a ripoff.. It lasted 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought the TV on Cyber Monday and it took almost 2 weeks to arrive. Once it arrived it worked great for 3 weeks. THEN it disconnected from the internet and WILL NOT reconnect. Amazon/Insignia had me take it to the Geek Squad who shipped it for repair. 3 weeks of qaiting only to get it back it connectedd in the store and does not work connect via wireless or Ethernet at home. Total waste of 💰
customer_reviews.author: Nicey

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good picture, fire tv is trash
customer_reviews.text: The Alexa function does not work. If you want this tv for the Alexa function do not bother. The menus are overly complicated for no reason and the main menu (the most important feature of a smart tv) is poor at best. The remote is also garbage. The picture quality of the tv is good, that and the price are the only saving grace. I will never buy a smart tv that uses fire tv again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great smart TV, but no volume buttons on TV
customer_reviews.text: I've had this TV for about a week and everything is working great! It's my first smart TV and it is very easy to use. My only complaint is that there are no volume buttons or other controls physically on the tv. There is only the power button. So if the remote is lost or broken you're kind of screwed. Other than that, this is a great smart TV
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marie

customer_reviews.title: worse tv I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the worse tv I have ever bought. Fire tv is a fluke, its program is fine if you like commercials. rokue has it beat time over time.The only enjoyment you can get outof this tv is watching prime,you be watching a show and the commercial will break in a middle of a sentance,you think you are watching a movie and you will be watching a commercial and not even know it. If there was anything lower then (0) I would rate it at that. An the same old commericals over and over and over, what a disrespect to the buyer,a piece of garbage I threw it in the trash can,let some other fool use it.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: We'll see...
customer_reviews.text: We're only on day 3 of owning this TV. It's great while it's connected to the wifi. However every time it shuts off, it loses it ability to reconnect to our wifi. It won't even recognize or see our neighbors wifi. We have to restart through settings EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. Then it'll find ours (and surrounding neighbors wifi) and I have to re-enter the password, again every single time. I have a message into Best buy to see if they'll send a tech or let us bring it in to fix the tv. So I'll update later of there's any progress. This tv is for our child's playroom so ease of use is necessary. So far it's pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Really good the remote paired flawlessly and the tv came in perfect condition. Easy setup, only one cord. Really good remote. Picture quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Goddard

customer_reviews.title: 😊
customer_reviews.text: I bought it very cheap before black Friday sale. The tv is great and works perfectly find. I have no problems. And my screen is perfectly find. I had no crack or screen disfigure problems. I have read other people's review. I did got my tv on a cold day and waited the next day to have the tv turn on and plug it. I didn't want my screen to be disfigure.
customer_reviews.author: Nilda

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Well I hooked it up yesterday and so far pretty pleased. It arrived intact. I took note of the problems people were having with it and so knew to pull the tv out by the handles, and knew where to look for the power plug connection. The set up was supper easy. it detected my wifi immediately and only had to input my password and it was up and running. I use it as a bedroom TV. I have the Amazon stick on my main TV so was already familiar with the format. It has youtube access which I watch a lot for the relaxation videos and music to lull me to sleep, so it's great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this tv for 6 months and about two months ago the internet will randomly disconnect and about three weeks ago the remote will give out. You have to restart the tv multiple of times to get the remote to work again. Other than that the YC has been great. The picture is good and the sound system is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Khadijah

customer_reviews.title: Picture and sound are better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: We put this Insignia NS-32DF310NA19 32-inch TV on the wall in front of the new treadmill. It mounted easily with the $16.00 wall mount. The picture is bright and clear and the Fire tv functions just like our other Firesticks. I had expected to need a sound bar but it sounds fine as it is and has good volume. I crank it up and hear it just fine over the treadmill noise. It is sturdy and feels like a solid build. All in all, I like it. It's better than I expected and as much as I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked for just long enough to run out of the return. It started saying that the memory or whatever was full and I would have to reset to factory settings. I did that twice. The third time it got stuck on language and would do anything else. Smart tv ... not that smart. My husband and I are older so it's not as if we are gaming or anything dramatic like that. I have an email into best buy to see what I can do. Its 8 days past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L Natale

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't been able to get the TV working with my alexa dot. It shows it is linked and active but will not make the connection. I have several Alexa enable devices and they were quick and easy to setup. The remote control voice button works fine, I'll just use that. I Don't understand why I had to create a best buy account to enable the Alexa skill? Now I just get spam email from Best Buy. The Television is okay, the sound quality could be better, but it will work for what I need. I would recommend just getting a Smart TV and using the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Insignia Smart HD TV - Fire TV Edition purchase. We initially bought one for the living room which is a 42 inch and loved it so much that we purchased one for our bedroom which is a 32 inch. The quality of the picture is outstanding and the ease of use is tremendous. We are an older couple so technology is sometimes tasking but not with these TV's. I would recommend this TV to anyone and everyone who is looking for excellent quality at a tremendous price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality matches the price
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is not great... very grainy and requires a lot of manual adjustment. You only get one Amazon (Insignia branded) remote, so it’s a pain to go through and make updates to the settings. Resolution on the TV is low, so plugging into a computer (as a second screen) is also blurry, even on the correct settings. For the price, it works for never-ending WFH, but not outside of that. Update- returning. No matter what setting, words and picture are too fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe83

customer_reviews.title: Video Quality Initially Poor But Good Quality Once Resolved
customer_reviews.text: Revised Review - After multiple reboots and assistance from Amazon Technical support video rendering improved to be good or very good. Review revised from 1-star to 4-stars. Loss of 1 star reflects difficulty in achieving good operation. Original Review - The rendered video quality was exceptionally poor when streaming directly from e.g. Amazon Prime over either Wi-Fi or Ethernet. This was especially true when the scene being rendered included significant motion. The resulting pixelation was severe and unusable. Operation with an external decoder into an HDMI port was good, but the unit is marketed as a "Fire TV" and so it failed to accomplish its primary mission.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Its a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This TV is a good gift to give someone its relatively cheap and has great quality the Fire TV interface is a plus. My only gripe is that apart from youtube I am not able to cast to it, Im not sure if there maybe an app i could download from the amazon store for this but for now its the only downside in has many options for connectors, sound and picture quality is great and its nice and bright. I'd definitely recommend to someone else to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: So... for the price you get a great TV BUT and there is a but, for some reason there is an issue with Amazon and Disney plus app. It downloads on the TV or if you have fire stick, but it doesn’t work! Yes there is a problem. And we have very fast internet connection. However for some reason anything with Amazon and Disney plus just don’t mesh well. We can access through Xbox or PlayStation but NOT Amazon. I do have to say it’s frustrating. TV is great otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: The TV is awesome! Love the picture, the apps and the easiness of learning how to find all the free stuff! My only complaint would be the voice recognition the darn thing hears other people's voice on and off the tv and tries to react. Sort of a pain! I haven't figured out how to disable that or fix it so it doesn't listen to the tv programs for directions.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Constant freezing issues
customer_reviews.text: I had to eventually return this item as it constantly froze when switching from television to Netflix or Prime. I did have email contact with the company and they kept telling me this was due to a 'software upgrade' to their remote. They told me to unplug the TV (which I had already been doing) and then after 30 seconds to manually hold the power button to resolve the issue. It didn't not resolve this issue. I should have read more reviews as others have been reporting this issue for quite a long time. I changed to a Toshiba Smart TV which while more expensive works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walker

customer_reviews.title: A mixed bag.
customer_reviews.text: Those television is way smarter than me. It has the ability to download all kinds of apps to make your streaming experience endless. For me, it's almost overwhelming when I turn it on. Picture is good. For some reason I am unable to see the information on our cable guide. Another negative for me is that the remote is not lighted - Very hard to see bottoms in a dark room. I have never tried the voice recognition. Overall, big hits and big misses.
customer_reviews.author: NCAA

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: this is a great tv. picture quality and sound is awesome, no glitches. i have a different, smaller Roku tv and the only thing im not a fan of is the roku remote. i do not like how the volume buttons are on the side. 75% of the time i just pick the remote up and the volume goes up, down or mutes. also, ugh, i do not like the "channel" buttons on the bottom. i do not use any of those services. but the tv is cool and i like it enough to look past the remote.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This tv constantly has problems where it goes black and kicks back out to home screen. It also has internet connection problems. I have tried everything to fix internet problem, no other device loses connectivity like this tv. It also does not save my WiFi password and I have to enter it about every other time I use it. All the apps are otherwise fast except for the firetv movies and shows, they take about 30 seconds to a minute to load, but sometimes will not load and kick me out to home screen.
customer_reviews.author: agill

customer_reviews.title: A nice super easy to set up tv.
customer_reviews.text: All we wanted was a small tv for our bedroom to be on while my husband sleeps during the day. This was the best we found for an actual tv. Set up was super easy. Picture and sound is great for what we want. The only downside is it's super bright when you first turn it on. Not a good thing when you are in a dark room and someone is sleeping. Found how to adjust picture for when shows are playing but not how you adjust brightness for the home screen.
customer_reviews.author: Ret Chief Wife

customer_reviews.title: FIVR STARS PLUS
customer_reviews.text: First let me say, I am a big alexa supporter, was selected to purchase one of the first echos. Have purchased most all of the echo supported devices. The tv is responsive to our voices and love the voice recognition from dot to the tv. It has been almost a month and a half since we first received the tv and use it every day. Still learning and alexa is too. Just wish we had purchased the tv sooner. Don't do a lot of reviews but Alexa deserves 5 stars plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 24hours
customer_reviews.text: Controller stopped working within 24 hours of opening the box. We donated my daughters old tv to a family in need. That tv lasted us 12 years. Guess we shouldof waited longer than 24 hours to give it away. The remote turns tv on and off but that's it. You cant select anything on the screen and you cant set up the internet connection. This one is disappointing and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have steady access to WiFi get a real tv. I hate how this tv requires WiFi to do anything. It won’t allow a preset aside from the Amazon home screen. Aside from that it’s a fine tv. Just a lot of features you can’t use. Now I’m speaking for myself in a rural environment right now. I bought this for college so I’m sure then it will be great. The picture and refresh rate isn’t that bad honestly and I think the tv overall is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Titillating Televisions isn’t Thrilling
customer_reviews.text: Great Television of the price. Have had issues with the pic quality as well as the tv reverting back to the home screen when the “storage” is full. Have had to reset TV multiple times which is frustrating because then you have to sign back into everything so make sure you write down the emails and passwords assoc with the apps you download. Google has helped a lot with fixing the issue of the reverting to home screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M Honecker

customer_reviews.title: Know what your buying.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews prior to purchasing this Fire TV. We are prime members and have plenty of experience with the Fire TV Adaptor. So we are very familiar in navigating the Fire TV menus/ technologies. This TV is perfect for us as a result. Be sure you are aware of the product your buying, I’m sure the people who gave this tv a negative review just did not know they were buying a TV set up primarily for Amazon Fire technology.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: TV worked fine for 10 days
customer_reviews.text: The television worked wonderfully for 10 days, then issues started to happen. I watched a move on Prime, then the next evening it would not stream another movie. The following day I could not live stream CNN, then I had an issue trying to live stream another channel. After these issues the remote stopped communicating with the Television. I even put new batteries into the remote. I returned the TV and purchased another brand.
customer_reviews.author: MiaAthena

customer_reviews.title: Worst TV I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This tv worked well for about a month. Now it’s a giant paper weight that they refused to replace. Initially it had issues with playback of any video. The other tv and devices in the house have no issues at all. It’s isolated to this tv. After attempting every recommended reset it is now stuck on the language set up screen. Hopefully the manufacturer warranty will cover this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sucks!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: first off shipping sucked.. This is how it was sitting on my porch when I got home. With a 60% chance of rain after we already received 7 inches of rain in 2 days. I was surprised a porch pirate didn't lift it off my porch! Now 3 months later I come home with a pizza to netflix and chill....and I have all these black lines running up the screen and no picture. Of course the return date was only 30 days after I purchased it. I believe I was scammed. wish I could give it minus stars
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Over the air cord cutters
customer_reviews.text: We are cord cutters..bought this tv for that reason recommend for ota quality plus streaming.....ota not getting the channels that we get on our roku tv that is a minus...streaming, sound and picture and the use of functions are all very good...we have a issue every once in awhile the tv turns itself off and on...no big deal...this actually was our second tv first one that came box had a gouge in it ups ask if we like to return it I said no the tv did not look damaged but it was amizon and best buy were the absolute best at serving the return
customer_reviews.author: queenky

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality blew me away! This is a very responsive excellent TV. I got it as an upgrade for my sons room and now I wish I got myself one. The whole concept of a SmartTV is super convenient. I haven't had any issues with apps or connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Insignia NS-32DF310NA19 32-inch Smart HD TV - Fire TV Edition
product_meta.description: Size:32-inch| Style:HDInsignia HD Smart TV is a new generation of smart TVs featuring the Fire TV experience built-in and including a Voice Remote with Alexa. With HD picture quality and access to all the movies and TV shows you love, Toshiba Fire TV Edition delivers a superior TV experience that gets smarter every day. The Voice Remote with Alexa lets you do everything you'd expect from a remote—plus, easily launch apps, search for TV shows, play music, switch inputs, control smart home devices and more, using just your voice.
feature_bullets: Insignia HD Smart TV – Fire TV Edition delivers 720p picture quality with deep blacks and rich colors.
With the Fire TV experience built-in, enjoy tens of thousands of channels, apps, and Alexa skills, including Disney+, Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Hulu, SHOWTIME, STARZ, and more
Fire TV Edition seamlessly integrates live over-the-air TV and streaming channels on a unified home screen (HD antenna required).
Easily control your TV with the included Voice Remote with Alexa—plus, launch apps, search for titles, play music, switch inputs, control smart home devices, and more, using just your voice.

Dimensions (W x H x D): TV without stand: 28.9” x 17.3” x 3”, TV with stand: 28.9” x 19” x 8.2”. Multiple device input/output options: 3 HDMI including 1 with ARC, USB, composite input, antenna/cable input, digital output (optical), audio output, Ethernet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars10,962 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
